trans-unit.target: What s New in Windows PowerShell 50

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: What's New in Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: What's New in Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell ® 5.0 includes significant new features that extend its use, improve its usability, and allow you to control and manage Windows-based environments more easily and comprehensively.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell ® 5.0 includes significant new features that extend its use, improve its usability, and allow you to control and manage Windows-based environments more easily and comprehensively.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 5.0 is backward-compatible.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 5.0 is backward-compatible.

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets, providers, modules, snap-ins, scripts, functions, and profiles that were designed for Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 3.0, and Windows PowerShell 2.0 generally work in Windows PowerShell 5.0 without changes.
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets, providers, modules, snap-ins, scripts, functions, and profiles that were designed for Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 3.0, and Windows PowerShell 2.0 generally work in Windows PowerShell 5.0 without changes.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 5.0 is installed by default on Windows Server ® 2016 Technical Preview and Windows 10 ®.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 5.0 is installed by default on Windows Server ® 2016 Technical Preview and Windows 10 ®.

trans-unit.source: To install Windows PowerShell 5.0 on Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8.1 Enterprise, or Windows 8.1 Pro, download and install [Windows Management Framework 5.0](http://aka.ms/wmf5download).
trans-unit.target: To install Windows PowerShell 5.0 on Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows 8.1 Enterprise, or Windows 8.1 Pro, download and install [Windows Management Framework 5.0](http://aka.ms/wmf5download).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to read the download details, and meet all system requirements, before you install Windows Management Framework 5.0.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to read the download details, and meet all system requirements, before you install Windows Management Framework 5.0.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 4.0 updates in November 2014 update rollup (KB 3000850)
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 4.0 updates in November 2014 update rollup (KB 3000850)

trans-unit.source: Many updates and improvements to Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) in Windows PowerShell 4.0 are available in the [November 2014 update rollup for Windows RT 8.1, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 R2](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3000850/) (KB 3000850).
trans-unit.target: Many updates and improvements to Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) in Windows PowerShell 4.0 are available in the [November 2014 update rollup for Windows RT 8.1, Windows 8.1, and Windows Server 2012 R2](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3000850/) (KB 3000850).

trans-unit.source: You can determine if KB 3000850 is installed on your system by running `Get-Hotfix -Id KB3000850` in Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You can determine if KB 3000850 is installed on your system by running `Get-Hotfix -Id KB3000850` in Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Updates to existing cmdlets in the [PSDesiredStateConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn391651(v=wps.640).aspx) module
trans-unit.target: Updates to existing cmdlets in the [PSDesiredStateConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn391651(v=wps.640).aspx) module

trans-unit.source: [Get-DscResource](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521625.aspx) is faster (especially in ISE).
trans-unit.target: [Get-DscResource](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521625.aspx) is faster (especially in ISE).

trans-unit.source: [Start-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521623.aspx) has a new parameter, –UseExisting, which reapplies the last applied configuration.
trans-unit.target: [Start-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521623.aspx) has a new parameter, –UseExisting, which reapplies the last applied configuration.

trans-unit.source: [Start-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521623.aspx) -Force has been fixed.
trans-unit.target: [Start-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521623.aspx) -Force has been fixed.

trans-unit.source: [Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn407378.aspx) displays more useful information about the engine state.
trans-unit.target: [Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn407378.aspx) displays more useful information about the engine state.

trans-unit.source: [Test-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn407382.aspx) now returns the computer name along with True or False.
trans-unit.target: [Test-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn407382.aspx) now returns the computer name along with True or False.

trans-unit.source: [New-DscChecksum](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521622.aspx) now supports UNC paths.
trans-unit.target: [New-DscChecksum](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn521622.aspx) now supports UNC paths.

trans-unit.source: New cmdlets in the [PSDesiredStateConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn391651(v=wps.640).aspx) module
trans-unit.target: New cmdlets in the [PSDesiredStateConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn391651(v=wps.640).aspx) module

trans-unit.source: [Update-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt143541(v=wps.630).aspx): Performs an on-demand pull server check.
trans-unit.target: [Update-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt143541(v=wps.630).aspx): Performs an on-demand pull server check.

trans-unit.source: [Stop-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt143542(v=wps.630).aspx): Stops a configuration that is already running.
trans-unit.target: [Stop-DscConfiguration](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt143542(v=wps.630).aspx): Stops a configuration that is already running.

trans-unit.source: [Remove-DscConfigurationDocument](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt143544(v=wps.630).aspx): Lets you remove configuration documents in various stages (pending, previous, or current).
trans-unit.target: [Remove-DscConfigurationDocument](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt143544(v=wps.630).aspx): Lets you remove configuration documents in various stages (pending, previous, or current).

trans-unit.source: Language enhancements
trans-unit.target: Language enhancements

trans-unit.source: DependsOn now supports composite resources.
trans-unit.target: DependsOn now supports composite resources.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn now supports numbers in resource instance names.
trans-unit.target: DependsOn now supports numbers in resource instance names.

trans-unit.source: Node expressions that evaluate to empty no longer throw errors.
trans-unit.target: Node expressions that evaluate to empty no longer throw errors.

trans-unit.source: An error that occurs if a node expression evaluates to empty has been fixed.
trans-unit.target: An error that occurs if a node expression evaluates to empty has been fixed.

trans-unit.source: Configurations calling configurations now work in the Windows PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: Configurations calling configurations now work in the Windows PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Pull mode enhancements
trans-unit.target: Pull mode enhancements

trans-unit.source: Pull mode now supports all ZIP files.
trans-unit.target: Pull mode now supports all ZIP files.

trans-unit.source: **AllowModuleOverwrite** now works correctly.
trans-unit.target: **AllowModuleOverwrite** now works correctly.

trans-unit.source: Resiliency improvements
trans-unit.target: Resiliency improvements

trans-unit.source: New **DebugMode** lets you reload resource modules.
trans-unit.target: New **DebugMode** lets you reload resource modules.

trans-unit.source: If a configuration failure occurs, the pending.mof file is not deleted.
trans-unit.target: If a configuration failure occurs, the pending.mof file is not deleted.

trans-unit.source: The Local Configuration Manager (LCM) is now more resilient when metaconfiguration settings have become corrupted.
trans-unit.target: The Local Configuration Manager (LCM) is now more resilient when metaconfiguration settings have become corrupted.

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic improvements
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic improvements

trans-unit.source: A warning is displayed when the LCM sets the timer to different settings than you have specified.
trans-unit.target: A warning is displayed when the LCM sets the timer to different settings than you have specified.

trans-unit.source: Error log files now contain the call stack for Windows PowerShell resources.
trans-unit.target: Error log files now contain the call stack for Windows PowerShell resources.

trans-unit.source: Flexibility improvements
trans-unit.target: Flexibility improvements

trans-unit.source: The LocalConfigurationManager resource has a new property, **ActionAfterReboot**.
trans-unit.target: The LocalConfigurationManager resource has a new property, **ActionAfterReboot**.

trans-unit.source: ContinueConfiguration (default value): Automatically resumes a configuration after a target node restarts.
trans-unit.target: ContinueConfiguration (default value): Automatically resumes a configuration after a target node restarts.

trans-unit.source: StopConfiguration: Do not automatically resume a configuration after a node restarts.
trans-unit.target: StopConfiguration: Do not automatically resume a configuration after a node restarts.

trans-unit.source: A consistency run can now occur more often than a PULL operation, or vice-versa.
trans-unit.target: A consistency run can now occur more often than a PULL operation, or vice-versa.

trans-unit.source: Versioning support: DSC can now recognize a document that was generated on a newer client (included with [WMF 5.0](http://aka.ms/wmf5download)).
trans-unit.target: Versioning support: DSC can now recognize a document that was generated on a newer client (included with [WMF 5.0](http://aka.ms/wmf5download)).

trans-unit.source: Error prevention improvements
trans-unit.target: Error prevention improvements

trans-unit.source: Module version is now enforced before a configuration is applied.
trans-unit.target: Module version is now enforced before a configuration is applied.

trans-unit.source: **DebugPreference** is now set correctly for Get-, Set-, or Test-TargetResource calls.
trans-unit.target: **DebugPreference** is now set correctly for Get-, Set-, or Test-TargetResource calls.

trans-unit.source: Credential handling improvements
trans-unit.target: Credential handling improvements

trans-unit.source: A certificate is now used, if both **Certificate** and **PSDscAllowPlainTextPassword** are specified.
trans-unit.target: A certificate is now used, if both **Certificate** and **PSDscAllowPlainTextPassword** are specified.

trans-unit.source: Credentials are decrypted, even for Get-TargetResource.
trans-unit.target: Credentials are decrypted, even for Get-TargetResource.

trans-unit.source: Metaconfiguration credentials are encrypted and decrypted.
trans-unit.target: Metaconfiguration credentials are encrypted and decrypted.

trans-unit.source: PSCredentials are now decrypted when they are in an embedded object.
trans-unit.target: PSCredentials are now decrypted when they are in an embedded object.

trans-unit.source: Built-in resource improvements
trans-unit.target: Built-in resource improvements

trans-unit.source: The Package resource
trans-unit.target: The Package resource

trans-unit.source: No longer installs the wrong package (either from local or web sources).
trans-unit.target: No longer installs the wrong package (either from local or web sources).

trans-unit.source: Now supports HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Now supports HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: There is now support for HTTPS in the [Package resource](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn282132.aspx).
trans-unit.target: There is now support for HTTPS in the [Package resource](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn282132.aspx).

trans-unit.source: [Archive resource](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn249917.aspx) now supports credentials.
trans-unit.target: [Archive resource](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn249917.aspx) now supports credentials.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: [New features in Windows PowerShell](#BKMK_newcore)
trans-unit.target: [New features in Windows PowerShell](#BKMK_newcore)

trans-unit.source: [New features in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration](#BKMK_newDSC)
trans-unit.target: [New features in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration](#BKMK_newDSC)

trans-unit.source: [New features in Windows PowerShell ISE](#BKMK_newISE)
trans-unit.target: [New features in Windows PowerShell ISE](#BKMK_newISE)

trans-unit.source: [New features in Windows PowerShell Web Services](#BKMK_newOData)
trans-unit.target: [New features in Windows PowerShell Web Services](#BKMK_newOData)

trans-unit.source: [Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 5.0](#BKMK_5bugfix)
trans-unit.target: [Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 5.0](#BKMK_5bugfix)

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can develop by using classes, by using formal syntax and semantics that are similar to other object-oriented programming languages.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can develop by using classes, by using formal syntax and semantics that are similar to other object-oriented programming languages.

trans-unit.source: **Class**, **Enum**, and other keywords have been added to the Windows PowerShell language to support the new feature.
trans-unit.target: **Class**, **Enum**, and other keywords have been added to the Windows PowerShell language to support the new feature.

trans-unit.source: For more information about working with classes, see about_Classes.
trans-unit.target: For more information about working with classes, see about_Classes.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 5.0 introduces a new, structured information stream that you can use to transmit structured data between a script and its callers (or hosting environment).
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 5.0 introduces a new, structured information stream that you can use to transmit structured data between a script and its callers (or hosting environment).

trans-unit.source: You can now use Write-Host to emit output to the information stream.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Write-Host to emit output to the information stream.

trans-unit.source: Information streams also work for PowerShell.Streams, jobs, scheduled jobs, and workflows.
trans-unit.target: Information streams also work for PowerShell.Streams, jobs, scheduled jobs, and workflows.

trans-unit.source: The following features support the information stream.
trans-unit.target: The following features support the information stream.

trans-unit.source: A new Write-Information cmdlet that lets you specify how Windows PowerShell handles information stream data for a command.
trans-unit.target: A new Write-Information cmdlet that lets you specify how Windows PowerShell handles information stream data for a command.

trans-unit.source: Write-Host is a wrapper for Write-Information.
trans-unit.target: Write-Host is a wrapper for Write-Information.

trans-unit.source: Write-Information is also a supported workflow activity.
trans-unit.target: Write-Information is also a supported workflow activity.

trans-unit.source: Two new common parameters, InformationVariable and InformationAction, let you determine how information streams from a command are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Two new common parameters, InformationVariable and InformationAction, let you determine how information streams from a command are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Valid values for InformationAction are SilentlyContinue, Stop, Continue, Inquire, Ignore, or Suspend, with SilentlyContinue being the default.
trans-unit.target: Valid values for InformationAction are SilentlyContinue, Stop, Continue, Inquire, Ignore, or Suspend, with SilentlyContinue being the default.

trans-unit.source: InformationVariable specifies a string as the name of a variable to which you want the Write-Host data from a command saved.
trans-unit.target: InformationVariable specifies a string as the name of a variable to which you want the Write-Host data from a command saved.

trans-unit.source: A new preference variable, InformationPreference, specifies your default preference for information stream data in a Windows PowerShell session.
trans-unit.target: A new preference variable, InformationPreference, specifies your default preference for information stream data in a Windows PowerShell session.

trans-unit.source: The default value is SilentlyContinue.
trans-unit.target: The default value is SilentlyContinue.

trans-unit.source: Two new workflow common parameters, PSInformation and InformationAction, have been added.
trans-unit.target: Two new workflow common parameters, PSInformation and InformationAction, have been added.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Format-Table command, table columns are now automatically formatted by evaluating the first 300ms of data that passes through the stream.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Format-Table command, table columns are now automatically formatted by evaluating the first 300ms of data that passes through the stream.

trans-unit.source: In collaboration with [Microsoft Research](http://research.microsoft.com/), a new cmdlet, ConvertFrom-String, has been added.
trans-unit.target: In collaboration with [Microsoft Research](http://research.microsoft.com/), a new cmdlet, ConvertFrom-String, has been added.

trans-unit.source: ConvertFrom-String lets you extract and parse structured objects from the content of text strings.
trans-unit.target: ConvertFrom-String lets you extract and parse structured objects from the content of text strings.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see ConvertFrom-String.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see ConvertFrom-String.

trans-unit.source: A new Convert-String cmdlet automatically formats text based on an example that you provide in an -Example parameter.
trans-unit.target: A new Convert-String cmdlet automatically formats text based on an example that you provide in an -Example parameter.

trans-unit.source: A new module, Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive, includes cmdlets that let you compress files and folders into archive (also known as ZIP) files, extract files from existing ZIP files, and update ZIP files with newer versions of files compressed within them.
trans-unit.target: A new module, Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive, includes cmdlets that let you compress files and folders into archive (also known as ZIP) files, extract files from existing ZIP files, and update ZIP files with newer versions of files compressed within them.

trans-unit.source: A new module, PackageManagement, lets you discover and install software packages on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: A new module, PackageManagement, lets you discover and install software packages on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: The PackageManagement (formerly known as OneGet) module is a manager or multiplexer of existing package managers (also called package providers) to unify Windows package management with a single Windows PowerShell interface.
trans-unit.target: The PackageManagement (formerly known as OneGet) module is a manager or multiplexer of existing package managers (also called package providers) to unify Windows package management with a single Windows PowerShell interface.

trans-unit.source: A new module, PowerShellGet, lets you find, install, publish, and update modules and DSC resources on the [PowerShell Gallery](http://www.powershellgallery.com/), or on an internal module repository that you can set up by running the Register-PSRepository cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: A new module, PowerShellGet, lets you find, install, publish, and update modules and DSC resources on the [PowerShell Gallery](http://www.powershellgallery.com/), or on an internal module repository that you can set up by running the Register-PSRepository cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: A new language keyword, **Hidden**, has been added to specify that a member (a property or a method) is not shown by default in Get-Member results (unless you add the -Force parameter).
trans-unit.target: A new language keyword, **Hidden**, has been added to specify that a member (a property or a method) is not shown by default in Get-Member results (unless you add the -Force parameter).

trans-unit.source: Properties or methods that have been marked hidden also do not show up in IntelliSense results, unless you are in a context where the member should be visible; for example, the automatic variable $This should show hidden members when in the class method.
trans-unit.target: Properties or methods that have been marked hidden also do not show up in IntelliSense results, unless you are in a context where the member should be visible; for example, the automatic variable $This should show hidden members when in the class method.

trans-unit.source: New-Item, Remove-Item, and Get-ChildItem have been enhanced to support creating and managing [symbolic links](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbolic_link).
trans-unit.target: New-Item, Remove-Item, and Get-ChildItem have been enhanced to support creating and managing [symbolic links](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbolic_link).

trans-unit.source: The **-ItemType** parameter for New-Item accepts a new value, **SymbolicLink**.
trans-unit.target: The **-ItemType** parameter for New-Item accepts a new value, **SymbolicLink**.

trans-unit.source: Now you can create symbolic links in a single line by running the New-Item cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Now you can create symbolic links in a single line by running the New-Item cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Get-ChildItem also has a new –Depth parameter, which you use with the –Recurse parameter to limit the recursion.
trans-unit.target: Get-ChildItem also has a new –Depth parameter, which you use with the –Recurse parameter to limit the recursion.

trans-unit.source: For example, Get-ChildItem –Recurse –Depth 2 returns results from the current folder, all of the child folders within the current folder, and all of the folders within the child folders.
trans-unit.target: For example, Get-ChildItem –Recurse –Depth 2 returns results from the current folder, all of the child folders within the current folder, and all of the folders within the child folders.

trans-unit.source: Copy-Item now lets you copy files or folders from one Windows PowerShell session to another, meaning that you can copy files to sessions that are connected to remote computers, (including computers that are running [Nano Server](http://blogs.technet.com/b/windowsserver/archive/2015/04/08/microsoft-announces-nano-server-for-modern-apps-and-cloud.aspx), and thus have no other interface).
trans-unit.target: Copy-Item now lets you copy files or folders from one Windows PowerShell session to another, meaning that you can copy files to sessions that are connected to remote computers, (including computers that are running [Nano Server](http://blogs.technet.com/b/windowsserver/archive/2015/04/08/microsoft-announces-nano-server-for-modern-apps-and-cloud.aspx), and thus have no other interface).

trans-unit.source: To copy files, specify PSSession IDs as the value of the new -FromSession and -ToSession parameters, and add –Path and –Destination to specify origin path and destination, respectively.
trans-unit.target: To copy files, specify PSSession IDs as the value of the new -FromSession and -ToSession parameters, and add –Path and –Destination to specify origin path and destination, respectively.

trans-unit.source: For example, Copy-Item -Path c:\\myFile.txt -ToSession $s -Destination d:\\destinationFolder.
trans-unit.target: For example, Copy-Item -Path c:\\myFile.txt -ToSession $s -Destination d:\\destinationFolder.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell transcription has been improved to apply to all hosting applications (such as Windows PowerShell ISE) in addition to the console host (**powershell.exe**).
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell transcription has been improved to apply to all hosting applications (such as Windows PowerShell ISE) in addition to the console host (**powershell.exe**).

trans-unit.source: Transcription options (including enabling a system-wide transcript) can be configured by enabling the **Turn on PowerShell Transcription** Group Policy setting, found in Administrative Templates/Windows Components/Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Transcription options (including enabling a system-wide transcript) can be configured by enabling the **Turn on PowerShell Transcription** Group Policy setting, found in Administrative Templates/Windows Components/Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: A new detailed script tracing feature lets you enable detailed tracking and analysis of Windows PowerShell scripting use on a system.
trans-unit.target: A new detailed script tracing feature lets you enable detailed tracking and analysis of Windows PowerShell scripting use on a system.

trans-unit.source: After you enable detailed script tracing, Windows PowerShell logs all script blocks to the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) event log, **Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational**.
trans-unit.target: After you enable detailed script tracing, Windows PowerShell logs all script blocks to the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) event log, **Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell/Operational**.

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, new Cryptographic Message Syntax cmdlets support encryption and decryption of content by using the IETF standard format for cryptographically protecting messages as documented by [RFC5652](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5652).
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, new Cryptographic Message Syntax cmdlets support encryption and decryption of content by using the IETF standard format for cryptographically protecting messages as documented by [RFC5652](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5652).

trans-unit.source: The Get-CmsMessage, Protect-CmsMessage, and Unprotect-CmsMessage cmdlets have been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Security](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849807.aspx) module.
trans-unit.target: The Get-CmsMessage, Protect-CmsMessage, and Unprotect-CmsMessage cmdlets have been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Security](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849807.aspx) module.

trans-unit.source: New cmdlets in the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module, Get-Runspace, Debug-Runspace, Get-RunspaceDebug, Enable-RunspaceDebug, and Disable-RunspaceDebug, let you set debug options on a runspace, and start and stop debugging on a runspace.
trans-unit.target: New cmdlets in the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module, Get-Runspace, Debug-Runspace, Get-RunspaceDebug, Enable-RunspaceDebug, and Disable-RunspaceDebug, let you set debug options on a runspace, and start and stop debugging on a runspace.

trans-unit.source: For debugging arbitrary runspaces—that is, runspaces that are not the default runspace for a Windows PowerShell console or Windows PowerShell ISE session—Windows PowerShell lets you set breakpoints in a script, and have added breakpoints stop the script from running until you can attach a debugger to debug the runspace script.
trans-unit.target: For debugging arbitrary runspaces—that is, runspaces that are not the default runspace for a Windows PowerShell console or Windows PowerShell ISE session—Windows PowerShell lets you set breakpoints in a script, and have added breakpoints stop the script from running until you can attach a debugger to debug the runspace script.

trans-unit.source: Nested debugging support for arbitrary runspaces has been added to the Windows PowerShell script debugger for runspaces.
trans-unit.target: Nested debugging support for arbitrary runspaces has been added to the Windows PowerShell script debugger for runspaces.

trans-unit.source: A new Format-Hex cmdlet has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module.
trans-unit.target: A new Format-Hex cmdlet has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module.

trans-unit.source: Format-Hex lets you view text or binary data in hexadecimal format.
trans-unit.target: Format-Hex lets you view text or binary data in hexadecimal format.

trans-unit.source: Get-Clipboard and Set-Clipboard cmdlets have been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module; they ease the transfer of content to and from a Windows PowerShell session.
trans-unit.target: Get-Clipboard and Set-Clipboard cmdlets have been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module; they ease the transfer of content to and from a Windows PowerShell session.

trans-unit.source: The Clipboard cmdlets support images, audio files, file lists, and text.
trans-unit.target: The Clipboard cmdlets support images, audio files, file lists, and text.

trans-unit.source: A new cmdlet, Clear-RecycleBin, has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Management](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849827(v=wps.640).aspx) module; this cmdlet empties the Recycle Bin for a fixed drive, which includes external drives.
trans-unit.target: A new cmdlet, Clear-RecycleBin, has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Management](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849827(v=wps.640).aspx) module; this cmdlet empties the Recycle Bin for a fixed drive, which includes external drives.

trans-unit.source: By default, you are prompted to confirm a Clear-RecycleBin command, because the ConfirmImpact property of the cmdlet is set to ConfirmImpact.High.
trans-unit.target: By default, you are prompted to confirm a Clear-RecycleBin command, because the ConfirmImpact property of the cmdlet is set to ConfirmImpact.High.

trans-unit.source: A new cmdlet, New-TemporaryFile, lets you create a temporary file as part of scripting.
trans-unit.target: A new cmdlet, New-TemporaryFile, lets you create a temporary file as part of scripting.

trans-unit.source: By default, the new temporary file is created in ```C:\Users\<user name>\AppData\Local\Temp```.
trans-unit.target: By default, the new temporary file is created in ```C:\Users\<user name>\AppData\Local\Temp```.

trans-unit.source: The Out-File, Add-Content, and Set-Content cmdlets now have a new –NoNewline parameter, which omits a new line after the output.
trans-unit.target: The Out-File, Add-Content, and Set-Content cmdlets now have a new –NoNewline parameter, which omits a new line after the output.

trans-unit.source: The New-Guid cmdlet leverages the .NET Framework Guid class to generate a GUID, useful when you are writing scripts or DSC resources.
trans-unit.target: The New-Guid cmdlet leverages the .NET Framework Guid class to generate a GUID, useful when you are writing scripts or DSC resources.

trans-unit.source: Because file version information can be misleading, particularly after a file is patched, new FileVersionRaw and ProductVersionRaw script properties are available for FileInfo objects.
trans-unit.target: Because file version information can be misleading, particularly after a file is patched, new FileVersionRaw and ProductVersionRaw script properties are available for FileInfo objects.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can run the following command to display the values of these properties for powershell.exe, where $pid contains the process ID for a running session of Windows PowerShell: ```Get-Process -Id $pid -FileVersionInfo | Format-List *version* -Force```
trans-unit.target: For example, you can run the following command to display the values of these properties for powershell.exe, where $pid contains the process ID for a running session of Windows PowerShell: ```Get-Process -Id $pid -FileVersionInfo | Format-List *version* -Force```

trans-unit.source: New cmdlets Enter-PSHostProcess and Exit-PSHostProcess let you debug Windows PowerShell scripts in processes separate from the current process that is running in the Windows PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: New cmdlets Enter-PSHostProcess and Exit-PSHostProcess let you debug Windows PowerShell scripts in processes separate from the current process that is running in the Windows PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Run Enter-PSHostProcess to enter, or attach to, a specific process ID, and then run Get-Runspace to return the active runspaces within the process.
trans-unit.target: Run Enter-PSHostProcess to enter, or attach to, a specific process ID, and then run Get-Runspace to return the active runspaces within the process.

trans-unit.source: Run Exit-PSHostProcess to detach from the process when you are finished debugging the script within the process.
trans-unit.target: Run Exit-PSHostProcess to detach from the process when you are finished debugging the script within the process.

trans-unit.source: A new Wait-Debugger cmdlet has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module.
trans-unit.target: A new Wait-Debugger cmdlet has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849958.aspx) module.

trans-unit.source: You can run Wait-Debugger to stop a script in the debugger before running the next statement in the script.
trans-unit.target: You can run Wait-Debugger to stop a script in the debugger before running the next statement in the script.

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell Workflow debugger now supports command or tab completion, and you can debug nested workflow functions.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell Workflow debugger now supports command or tab completion, and you can debug nested workflow functions.

trans-unit.source: You can now press **Ctrl+Break** to enter the debugger in a running script, in both local and remote sessions, and in a workflow script.
trans-unit.target: You can now press **Ctrl+Break** to enter the debugger in a running script, in both local and remote sessions, and in a workflow script.

trans-unit.source: A Debug-Job cmdlet has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Core](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849695.aspx) module to debug running job scripts for Windows PowerShell Workflow, background, and jobs running in remote sessions.
trans-unit.target: A Debug-Job cmdlet has been added to the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Core](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849695.aspx) module to debug running job scripts for Windows PowerShell Workflow, background, and jobs running in remote sessions.

trans-unit.source: A new state, AtBreakpoint, has been added for Windows PowerShell jobs.
trans-unit.target: A new state, AtBreakpoint, has been added for Windows PowerShell jobs.

trans-unit.source: The AtBreakpoint state applies when a job is running a script that includes set breakpoints, and the script has hit a breakpoint.
trans-unit.target: The AtBreakpoint state applies when a job is running a script that includes set breakpoints, and the script has hit a breakpoint.

trans-unit.source: When a job is stopped at a debug breakpoint, you must debug the job by running the Debug-Job cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: When a job is stopped at a debug breakpoint, you must debug the job by running the Debug-Job cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 5.0 implements support for multiple versions of a single Windows PowerShell module in the same folder in $PSModulePath.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 5.0 implements support for multiple versions of a single Windows PowerShell module in the same folder in $PSModulePath.

trans-unit.source: A RequiredVersion property has been added to the ModuleSpecification class to help you get the desired version of a module; this property is mutually exclusive with the ModuleVersion property.
trans-unit.target: A RequiredVersion property has been added to the ModuleSpecification class to help you get the desired version of a module; this property is mutually exclusive with the ModuleVersion property.

trans-unit.source: RequiredVersion is now supported as part of the value of the FullyQualifiedName parameter of the Get-Module, Import-Module, and Remove-Module cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: RequiredVersion is now supported as part of the value of the FullyQualifiedName parameter of the Get-Module, Import-Module, and Remove-Module cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: You can now perform module version validation by running the Test-ModuleManifest cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can now perform module version validation by running the Test-ModuleManifest cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Results of the Get-Command cmdlet now display a Version column; a new Version property has been added to the CommandInfo class.
trans-unit.target: Results of the Get-Command cmdlet now display a Version column; a new Version property has been added to the CommandInfo class.

trans-unit.source: Get-Command shows commands from multiple versions of the same module.
trans-unit.target: Get-Command shows commands from multiple versions of the same module.

trans-unit.source: The Version property is also part of derived classes of CmdletInfo: CmdletInfo and ApplicationInfo.
trans-unit.target: The Version property is also part of derived classes of CmdletInfo: CmdletInfo and ApplicationInfo.

trans-unit.source: Get-Command has a new parameter, -ShowCommandInfo, that returns ShowCommand information as PSObjects.
trans-unit.target: Get-Command has a new parameter, -ShowCommandInfo, that returns ShowCommand information as PSObjects.

trans-unit.source: This is especially useful functionality for when Show-Command is run in Windows PowerShell ISE by using Windows PowerShell remoting.
trans-unit.target: This is especially useful functionality for when Show-Command is run in Windows PowerShell ISE by using Windows PowerShell remoting.

trans-unit.source: The –ShowCommandInfo parameter replaces the existing Get-SerializedCommand function in the Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility module, but the Get-SerializedCommand script is still available to support downlevel scripting.
trans-unit.target: The –ShowCommandInfo parameter replaces the existing Get-SerializedCommand function in the Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility module, but the Get-SerializedCommand script is still available to support downlevel scripting.

trans-unit.source: A new Get-ItemPropertyValue cmdlet lets you get the value of a property without using dot notation.
trans-unit.target: A new Get-ItemPropertyValue cmdlet lets you get the value of a property without using dot notation.

trans-unit.source: For example, in older releases of Windows PowerShell, you can run the following command to get the value of the Application Base property of the PowerShellEngine registry key: **(Get-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\PowerShell\\3\\PowerShellEngine -Name ApplicationBase).ApplicationBase**.
trans-unit.target: For example, in older releases of Windows PowerShell, you can run the following command to get the value of the Application Base property of the PowerShellEngine registry key: **(Get-ItemProperty -Path HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\PowerShell\\3\\PowerShellEngine -Name ApplicationBase).ApplicationBase**.

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can run **Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\PowerShell\\3\\PowerShellEngine -Name ApplicationBase**.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can run **Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\PowerShell\\3\\PowerShellEngine -Name ApplicationBase**.

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell console now uses syntax coloring, just as in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell console now uses syntax coloring, just as in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: A new NetworkSwitch module contains cmdlets that enable you to apply switch, virtual LAN (VLAN), and basic Layer 2 network switch port configuration to Windows Server 2012 R2 logo-certified network switches.
trans-unit.target: A new NetworkSwitch module contains cmdlets that enable you to apply switch, virtual LAN (VLAN), and basic Layer 2 network switch port configuration to Windows Server 2012 R2 logo-certified network switches.

trans-unit.source: The FullyQualifiedName parameter has been added to Import-Module and Remove-Module cmdlets, to support storing multiple versions of a single module.
trans-unit.target: The FullyQualifiedName parameter has been added to Import-Module and Remove-Module cmdlets, to support storing multiple versions of a single module.

trans-unit.source: Save-Help, Update-Help, Import-PSSession, Export-PSSession, and Get-Command have a new parameter, FullyQualifiedModule, of type ModuleSpecification.
trans-unit.target: Save-Help, Update-Help, Import-PSSession, Export-PSSession, and Get-Command have a new parameter, FullyQualifiedModule, of type ModuleSpecification.

trans-unit.source: Add this parameter to specify a module by its fully qualified name.
trans-unit.target: Add this parameter to specify a module by its fully qualified name.

trans-unit.source: The value of **$PSVersionTable.PSVersion** has been updated to 5.0.
trans-unit.target: The value of **$PSVersionTable.PSVersion** has been updated to 5.0.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell language enhancements let you define Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) resources by using classes.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell language enhancements let you define Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) resources by using classes.

trans-unit.source: Import-DscResource is now a true dynamic keyword; Windows PowerShell parses the specified module’s root module, searching for classes that contain the DscResource attribute.
trans-unit.target: Import-DscResource is now a true dynamic keyword; Windows PowerShell parses the specified module’s root module, searching for classes that contain the DscResource attribute.

trans-unit.source: You can now use classes to define DSC resources, in which neither a MOF file nor a DSCResource subfolder in the module folder is required.
trans-unit.target: You can now use classes to define DSC resources, in which neither a MOF file nor a DSCResource subfolder in the module folder is required.

trans-unit.source: A Windows PowerShell module file can contain multiple DSC resource classes.
trans-unit.target: A Windows PowerShell module file can contain multiple DSC resource classes.

trans-unit.source: A new parameter, ThrottleLimit, has been added to the following cmdlets in the PSDesiredStateConfiguration module.
trans-unit.target: A new parameter, ThrottleLimit, has been added to the following cmdlets in the PSDesiredStateConfiguration module.

trans-unit.source: Add the ThrottleLimit parameter to specify the number of target computers or devices on which you want the command to work at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Add the ThrottleLimit parameter to specify the number of target computers or devices on which you want the command to work at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Get-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Get-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: Get-DscConfigurationStatus
trans-unit.target: Get-DscConfigurationStatus

trans-unit.source: Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager
trans-unit.target: Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager

trans-unit.source: Restore-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Restore-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: Test-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Test-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: Compare-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Compare-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: Publish-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Publish-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager
trans-unit.target: Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager

trans-unit.source: Start-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Start-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: Update-DscConfiguration
trans-unit.target: Update-DscConfiguration

trans-unit.source: With centralized DSC error reporting, rich error information is not only logged in the event log, but it can be sent to a central location for later analysis.
trans-unit.target: With centralized DSC error reporting, rich error information is not only logged in the event log, but it can be sent to a central location for later analysis.

trans-unit.source: You can use this central location to store DSC configuration errors that have occurred for any server in their environment.
trans-unit.target: You can use this central location to store DSC configuration errors that have occurred for any server in their environment.

trans-unit.source: After the report server is defined in the meta-configuration, all errors are sent to the report server, and then stored in a database.
trans-unit.target: After the report server is defined in the meta-configuration, all errors are sent to the report server, and then stored in a database.

trans-unit.source: You can set up this functionality regardless of whether or not a target node is configured to pull configurations from a pull server.
trans-unit.target: You can set up this functionality regardless of whether or not a target node is configured to pull configurations from a pull server.

trans-unit.source: Improvements to Windows PowerShell ISE ease DSC resource authoring.
trans-unit.target: Improvements to Windows PowerShell ISE ease DSC resource authoring.

trans-unit.source: You can now do the following.
trans-unit.target: You can now do the following.

trans-unit.source: List all DSC resources within a **configuration** or **node** block by entering **Ctrl+Space** on a blank line within the block.
trans-unit.target: List all DSC resources within a **configuration** or **node** block by entering **Ctrl+Space** on a blank line within the block.

trans-unit.source: Automatic completion on resource properties of the **enumeration** type.
trans-unit.target: Automatic completion on resource properties of the **enumeration** type.

trans-unit.source: Automatic completion on the **DependsOn** property of DSC resources, based on other resource instances in the configuration.
trans-unit.target: Automatic completion on the **DependsOn** property of DSC resources, based on other resource instances in the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Improved tab completion of resource property values.
trans-unit.target: Improved tab completion of resource property values.

trans-unit.source: A user can now run a resource under a specified set of credentials by adding the **PSDscRunAsCredential** attribute to a Node block.
trans-unit.target: A user can now run a resource under a specified set of credentials by adding the **PSDscRunAsCredential** attribute to a Node block.

trans-unit.source: For example, PSDscRunAsCredential = Get-Credential Contoso\\DscUser.
trans-unit.target: For example, PSDscRunAsCredential = Get-Credential Contoso\\DscUser.

trans-unit.source: This functionality is useful for creating configurations that run Windows Installer and executable installers, access the per-user registry hive, or perform other tasks outside the current user context.
trans-unit.target: This functionality is useful for creating configurations that run Windows Installer and executable installers, access the per-user registry hive, or perform other tasks outside the current user context.

trans-unit.source: 32-bit (x86-based) support has been added for the **Configuration** keyword.
trans-unit.target: 32-bit (x86-based) support has been added for the **Configuration** keyword.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell now includes support for custom help for DSC configurations, defined by adding \[CmdletBinding()] to the generated configuration function.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell now includes support for custom help for DSC configurations, defined by adding \[CmdletBinding()] to the generated configuration function.

trans-unit.source: A new **DscLocalConfigurationManager** attribute designates a configuration block as a meta-configuration, which is used to configure the DSC Local Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: A new **DscLocalConfigurationManager** attribute designates a configuration block as a meta-configuration, which is used to configure the DSC Local Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: This attribute restricts a configuration to containing only items which configure the DSC Local Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: This attribute restricts a configuration to containing only items which configure the DSC Local Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: During processing, this configuration generates a \*.meta.mof file that is then sent to the appropriate target nodes by running the Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: During processing, this configuration generates a \*.meta.mof file that is then sent to the appropriate target nodes by running the Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Partial configurations are now allowed in Windows PowerShell 5.0.
trans-unit.target: Partial configurations are now allowed in Windows PowerShell 5.0.

trans-unit.source: You can deliver configuration documents to a node in fragments.
trans-unit.target: You can deliver configuration documents to a node in fragments.

trans-unit.source: For a node to receive multiple fragments of a configuration document, the node’s Local Configuration Manager must be first set to specify the expected fragments
trans-unit.target: For a node to receive multiple fragments of a configuration document, the node’s Local Configuration Manager must be first set to specify the expected fragments

trans-unit.source: Cross-computer synchronization is new in DSC in Windows PowerShell 5.0.
trans-unit.target: Cross-computer synchronization is new in DSC in Windows PowerShell 5.0.

trans-unit.source: By using the built-in WaitFor\* resources (**WaitForAll**, **WaitForAny**, and **WaitForSome**), you can now specify dependencies across computers during configuration runs, without external orchestrations.
trans-unit.target: By using the built-in WaitFor\* resources (**WaitForAll**, **WaitForAny**, and **WaitForSome**), you can now specify dependencies across computers during configuration runs, without external orchestrations.

trans-unit.source: These resources provide node-to-node synchronization by using CIM connections over the WS-Man protocol.
trans-unit.target: These resources provide node-to-node synchronization by using CIM connections over the WS-Man protocol.

trans-unit.source: A configuration can wait for another computer’s specific resource state to change.
trans-unit.target: A configuration can wait for another computer’s specific resource state to change.

trans-unit.source: Just Enough Administration (JEA), a new delegation security feature, leverages DSC and Windows PowerShell constrained runspaces to help secure enterprises from data loss or compromise by employees, whether intentional or unintentional.
trans-unit.target: Just Enough Administration (JEA), a new delegation security feature, leverages DSC and Windows PowerShell constrained runspaces to help secure enterprises from data loss or compromise by employees, whether intentional or unintentional.

trans-unit.source: For more information about JEA, including where you can download the xJEA DSC resource, see [Just Enough Administration, Step by Step](http://blogs.technet.com/b/privatecloud/archive/2014/05/14/just-enough-administration-step-by-step.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about JEA, including where you can download the xJEA DSC resource, see [Just Enough Administration, Step by Step](http://blogs.technet.com/b/privatecloud/archive/2014/05/14/just-enough-administration-step-by-step.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The following new cmdlets have been added to the PSDesiredStateConfiguration module.
trans-unit.target: The following new cmdlets have been added to the PSDesiredStateConfiguration module.

trans-unit.source: A new Get-DscConfigurationStatus cmdlet gets high-level information about configuration status from a target node.
trans-unit.target: A new Get-DscConfigurationStatus cmdlet gets high-level information about configuration status from a target node.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain the status of the last, or of all configurations.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain the status of the last, or of all configurations.

trans-unit.source: A new Compare-DscConfiguration cmdlet compares a specified configuration with the actual state of one or more target nodes.
trans-unit.target: A new Compare-DscConfiguration cmdlet compares a specified configuration with the actual state of one or more target nodes.

trans-unit.source: A new Publish-DscConfiguration cmdlet copies a configuration MOF file to a target node, but does not apply the configuration.
trans-unit.target: A new Publish-DscConfiguration cmdlet copies a configuration MOF file to a target node, but does not apply the configuration.

trans-unit.source: The configuration is applied during the next consistency pass, or when you run the Update-DscConfiguration cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: The configuration is applied during the next consistency pass, or when you run the Update-DscConfiguration cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: A new Test-DscConfiguration cmdlet lets you verify that a resulting configuration matches the desired configuration, returning either True if the configuration matches the desired configuration, or False if the actual configuration does not match the desired configuration.
trans-unit.target: A new Test-DscConfiguration cmdlet lets you verify that a resulting configuration matches the desired configuration, returning either True if the configuration matches the desired configuration, or False if the actual configuration does not match the desired configuration.

trans-unit.source: A new Update-DscConfiguration cmdlet forces a configuration to be processed.
trans-unit.target: A new Update-DscConfiguration cmdlet forces a configuration to be processed.

trans-unit.source: If the Local Configuration Manager is in pull mode, the cmdlet gets the configuration from the pull server before applying it.
trans-unit.target: If the Local Configuration Manager is in pull mode, the cmdlet gets the configuration from the pull server before applying it.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: You can now edit remote Windows PowerShell scripts and files in a local copy of Windows PowerShell ISE, by running Enter-PSSession to start a remote session on the computer that’s storing the files you want to edit, and then running **PSEdit <path and file name on the remote computer>**.
trans-unit.target: You can now edit remote Windows PowerShell scripts and files in a local copy of Windows PowerShell ISE, by running Enter-PSSession to start a remote session on the computer that’s storing the files you want to edit, and then running **PSEdit <path and file name on the remote computer>**.

trans-unit.source: This feature eases editing Windows PowerShell files that are stored on the Server Core installation option of Windows Server, where Windows PowerShell ISE cannot run.
trans-unit.target: This feature eases editing Windows PowerShell files that are stored on the Server Core installation option of Windows Server, where Windows PowerShell ISE cannot run.

trans-unit.source: The Start-Transcript cmdlet is now supported in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The Start-Transcript cmdlet is now supported in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: You can now debug remote scripts in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can now debug remote scripts in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: A new menu command, **Break All** (Ctrl+B), breaks into the debugger for both local and remotely-running scripts.
trans-unit.target: A new menu command, **Break All** (Ctrl+B), breaks into the debugger for both local and remotely-running scripts.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell Web Services (Management OData IIS Extension)
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell Web Services (Management OData IIS Extension)

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can generate a set of Windows PowerShell cmdlets based on the functionality exposed by a given OData endpoint, by running the Export-ODataEndpointProxy cmdlet, found in the new [Microsoft.PowerShell.OdataUtils](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn818507(v=wps.640).aspx) module.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can generate a set of Windows PowerShell cmdlets based on the functionality exposed by a given OData endpoint, by running the Export-ODataEndpointProxy cmdlet, found in the new [Microsoft.PowerShell.OdataUtils](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn818507(v=wps.640).aspx) module.

trans-unit.source: Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 5.0 includes a new COM implementation, which offers significant performance improvements when you are working with COM objects.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 5.0 includes a new COM implementation, which offers significant performance improvements when you are working with COM objects.

trans-unit.source: For a video demonstration of the effect, see [Com_Perf_Improvements](http://1drv.ms/1qu3UPZ).
trans-unit.target: For a video demonstration of the effect, see [Com_Perf_Improvements](http://1drv.ms/1qu3UPZ).

trans-unit.source: Significant performance improvements have been made to the first tab completion in a Windows PowerShell session, shortening tab completion time by nearly 500 ms.
trans-unit.target: Significant performance improvements have been made to the first tab completion in a Windows PowerShell session, shortening tab completion time by nearly 500 ms.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell 4.0
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell 4.0

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 4.0 is backward-compatible.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 4.0 is backward-compatible.

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets, providers, modules, snap-ins, scripts, functions, and profiles that were designed for Windows PowerShell 3.0 and Windows PowerShell 2.0 work in Windows PowerShell 4.0 without changes.
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets, providers, modules, snap-ins, scripts, functions, and profiles that were designed for Windows PowerShell 3.0 and Windows PowerShell 2.0 work in Windows PowerShell 4.0 without changes.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 4.0 is installed by default on WindowsÂ® 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 4.0 is installed by default on WindowsÂ® 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: To install Windows PowerShell 4.0 on Windows 7 with SP1, or Windows Server 2008 R2, download and install [Windows Management Framework 4.0](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=40855).
trans-unit.target: To install Windows PowerShell 4.0 on Windows 7 with SP1, or Windows Server 2008 R2, download and install [Windows Management Framework 4.0](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=40855).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to read the download details, and meet all system requirements, before you install Windows Management Framework 4.0.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to read the download details, and meet all system requirements, before you install Windows Management Framework 4.0.
