trans-unit.target: [Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 4.0](#BKMK_bugs)

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 4.0 includes the following new features.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 4.0 includes the following new features.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: **Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration** (DSC) is a new management system in Windows PowerShell 4.0 that enables the deployment and management of configuration data for software services and the environment in which these services run.
trans-unit.target: **Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration** (DSC) is a new management system in Windows PowerShell 4.0 that enables the deployment and management of configuration data for software services and the environment in which these services run.

trans-unit.source: For more information about DSC, see [Get Started with Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c134aa32-b085-4656-9a89-955d8ff768d0).
trans-unit.target: For more information about DSC, see [Get Started with Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c134aa32-b085-4656-9a89-955d8ff768d0).

trans-unit.source: **Save-Help** now lets you save help for modules that are installed on remote computers.
trans-unit.target: **Save-Help** now lets you save help for modules that are installed on remote computers.

trans-unit.source: You can use Save-Help to download module Help from an Internet-connected client (on which not all of the modules for which you want help are necessarily installed), and then copy the saved Help to a remote shared folder or a remote computer that does not have Internet access.
trans-unit.target: You can use Save-Help to download module Help from an Internet-connected client (on which not all of the modules for which you want help are necessarily installed), and then copy the saved Help to a remote shared folder or a remote computer that does not have Internet access.

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell debugger has been enhanced to allow debugging of Windows PowerShell workflows, as well as scripts that are running on remote computers.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell debugger has been enhanced to allow debugging of Windows PowerShell workflows, as well as scripts that are running on remote computers.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell workflows can now be debugged at the script level from either the Windows PowerShell command line or Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell workflows can now be debugged at the script level from either the Windows PowerShell command line or Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell scripts, including script workflows, can now be debugged over remote sessions.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell scripts, including script workflows, can now be debugged over remote sessions.

trans-unit.source: Remote debugging sessions are preserved over Windows PowerShell remote sessions that are disconnected and then later reconnected.
trans-unit.target: Remote debugging sessions are preserved over Windows PowerShell remote sessions that are disconnected and then later reconnected.

trans-unit.source: A **RunNow** parameter for **Register-ScheduledJob** and **Set-ScheduledJob** eliminates the need to set an immediate start date and time for jobs by using the **Trigger** parameter.
trans-unit.target: A **RunNow** parameter for **Register-ScheduledJob** and **Set-ScheduledJob** eliminates the need to set an immediate start date and time for jobs by using the **Trigger** parameter.

trans-unit.source: **Invoke-RestMethod** and **Invoke-WebRequest** now let you set all headers by using the Headers parameter.
trans-unit.target: **Invoke-RestMethod** and **Invoke-WebRequest** now let you set all headers by using the Headers parameter.

trans-unit.source: Although this parameter has always existed, it was one of several parameters for the web cmdlets that resulted in exceptions or errors.
trans-unit.target: Although this parameter has always existed, it was one of several parameters for the web cmdlets that resulted in exceptions or errors.

trans-unit.source: **Get-Module** has a new parameter, **FullyQualifiedName**, of the type **ModuleSpecification\[]**.
trans-unit.target: **Get-Module** has a new parameter, **FullyQualifiedName**, of the type **ModuleSpecification\[]**.

trans-unit.source: The **FullyQualifiedName** parameter of Get-Module now lets you specify a module by using the module's name, version, and optionally, its GUID.
trans-unit.target: The **FullyQualifiedName** parameter of Get-Module now lets you specify a module by using the module's name, version, and optionally, its GUID.

trans-unit.source: The default execution policy setting on Windows Server 2012 R2 is **RemoteSigned**.
trans-unit.target: The default execution policy setting on Windows Server 2012 R2 is **RemoteSigned**.

trans-unit.source: On Windows 8.1, there is no change in default setting.
trans-unit.target: On Windows 8.1, there is no change in default setting.

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows PowerShell 4.0, method invocation by using dynamic method names is supported.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows PowerShell 4.0, method invocation by using dynamic method names is supported.

trans-unit.source: You can use a variable to store a method name, and then dynamically invoke the method by calling the variable.
trans-unit.target: You can use a variable to store a method name, and then dynamically invoke the method by calling the variable.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous workflow jobs are no longer deleted when the time-out period that is specified by the **PSElapsedTimeoutSec** workflow common parameter has elapsed.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous workflow jobs are no longer deleted when the time-out period that is specified by the **PSElapsedTimeoutSec** workflow common parameter has elapsed.

trans-unit.source: A new parameter, **RepeatIndefinitely**, has been added to the **New-JobTrigger** and **Set-JobTrigger** cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: A new parameter, **RepeatIndefinitely**, has been added to the **New-JobTrigger** and **Set-JobTrigger** cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: This eliminates the necessity of specifying a **TimeSpan.MaxValue** value for the **RepetitionDuration** parameter to run a scheduled job repeatedly for an indefinite period.
trans-unit.target: This eliminates the necessity of specifying a **TimeSpan.MaxValue** value for the **RepetitionDuration** parameter to run a scheduled job repeatedly for an indefinite period.

trans-unit.source: A **Passthru** parameter has been added to the **Enable-JobTrigger** and **Disable-JobTrigger** cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: A **Passthru** parameter has been added to the **Enable-JobTrigger** and **Disable-JobTrigger** cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: The Passthru parameter displays any objects that are created or modified by your command.
trans-unit.target: The Passthru parameter displays any objects that are created or modified by your command.

trans-unit.source: The parameter names for specifying a workgroup in the **Add-Computer** and **Remove-Computer** cmdlets are now consistent.
trans-unit.target: The parameter names for specifying a workgroup in the **Add-Computer** and **Remove-Computer** cmdlets are now consistent.

trans-unit.source: Both cmdlets now use the parameter **WorkgroupName**.
trans-unit.target: Both cmdlets now use the parameter **WorkgroupName**.

trans-unit.source: A new common parameter, **PipelineVariable**, has been added.
trans-unit.target: A new common parameter, **PipelineVariable**, has been added.

trans-unit.source: PipelineVariable lets you save the results of a piped command (or part of a piped command) as a variable that can be passed through the remainder of the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: PipelineVariable lets you save the results of a piped command (or part of a piped command) as a variable that can be passed through the remainder of the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Collection filtering by using a method syntax is now supported.
trans-unit.target: Collection filtering by using a method syntax is now supported.

trans-unit.source: This means that you can now filter a collection of objects by using simplified syntax, similar to that for Where() or Where-Object, formatted as a method call.
trans-unit.target: This means that you can now filter a collection of objects by using simplified syntax, similar to that for Where() or Where-Object, formatted as a method call.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example: (Get-Process).where({$_.Name -match 'powershell'})
trans-unit.target: The following is an example: (Get-Process).where({$_.Name -match 'powershell'})

trans-unit.source: The **Get-Process** cmdlet has a new switch parameter, **IncludeUserName**.
trans-unit.target: The **Get-Process** cmdlet has a new switch parameter, **IncludeUserName**.

trans-unit.source: A new cmdlet, **Get-FileHash**, that returns a file hash in one of several formats for a specified file, has been added.
trans-unit.target: A new cmdlet, **Get-FileHash**, that returns a file hash in one of several formats for a specified file, has been added.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell 4.0, if a module uses the **DefaultCommandPrefix** key in its manifest, or if the user imports a module with the **Prefix** parameter, the **ExportedCommands** property of the module shows the commands in the module with the prefix.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell 4.0, if a module uses the **DefaultCommandPrefix** key in its manifest, or if the user imports a module with the **Prefix** parameter, the **ExportedCommands** property of the module shows the commands in the module with the prefix.

trans-unit.source: When you run the commands by using the module-qualified syntax, ModuleName\\CommandName, the command names must include the prefix.
trans-unit.target: When you run the commands by using the module-qualified syntax, ModuleName\\CommandName, the command names must include the prefix.

trans-unit.source: The value of **$PSVersionTable.PSVersion** has been updated to 4.0.
trans-unit.target: The value of **$PSVersionTable.PSVersion** has been updated to 4.0.

trans-unit.source: **Where()** operator behavior has changed.
trans-unit.target: **Where()** operator behavior has changed.

trans-unit.source: `Collection.Where('property –match name')` accepting a string expression in the format `"Property –CompareOperator Value"` is no longer supported.
trans-unit.target: `Collection.Where('property –match name')` accepting a string expression in the format `"Property –CompareOperator Value"` is no longer supported.

trans-unit.source: However, the **Where()** operator accepts string expressions in the format of a scriptblock; this is still supported.
trans-unit.target: However, the **Where()** operator accepts string expressions in the format of a scriptblock; this is still supported.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE)
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE)

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell ISE supports both Windows PowerShell Workflow debugging and remote script debugging.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell ISE supports both Windows PowerShell Workflow debugging and remote script debugging.

trans-unit.source: IntelliSense support has been added for Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration providers and configurations.
trans-unit.target: IntelliSense support has been added for Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration providers and configurations.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell Workflow
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell Workflow

trans-unit.source: Support has been added for a new **PipelineVariable** common parameter in the context of iterative pipelines, such as those used by System Center Orchestrator; that is, pipelines that run commands simply left-to-right, as opposed to interspersed running by using streaming.
trans-unit.target: Support has been added for a new **PipelineVariable** common parameter in the context of iterative pipelines, such as those used by System Center Orchestrator; that is, pipelines that run commands simply left-to-right, as opposed to interspersed running by using streaming.

trans-unit.source: Parameter binding has been significantly enhanced to work outside of tab completion scenarios, such as with commands that do not exist in the current runspace.
trans-unit.target: Parameter binding has been significantly enhanced to work outside of tab completion scenarios, such as with commands that do not exist in the current runspace.

trans-unit.source: Support for custom container activities has been added to Windows PowerShell Workflow.
trans-unit.target: Support for custom container activities has been added to Windows PowerShell Workflow.

trans-unit.source: If an activity parameter is of the types **Activity**, **Activity\[]**—or is a generic collection of activities—and the user has supplied a script block as an argument, then Windows PowerShell Workflow converts the script block to XAML, as with normal Windows PowerShell script-to-workflow compilation.
trans-unit.target: If an activity parameter is of the types **Activity**, **Activity\[]**—or is a generic collection of activities—and the user has supplied a script block as an argument, then Windows PowerShell Workflow converts the script block to XAML, as with normal Windows PowerShell script-to-workflow compilation.

trans-unit.source: After a crash, Windows PowerShell Workflow automatically reconnects to managed nodes.
trans-unit.target: After a crash, Windows PowerShell Workflow automatically reconnects to managed nodes.

trans-unit.source: You can now throttle **Foreach -Parallel** activity statements by using the **ThrottleLimit** property.
trans-unit.target: You can now throttle **Foreach -Parallel** activity statements by using the **ThrottleLimit** property.

trans-unit.source: The **ErrorAction** common parameter has a new valid value, **Suspend**, that is exclusively for workflows.
trans-unit.target: The **ErrorAction** common parameter has a new valid value, **Suspend**, that is exclusively for workflows.

trans-unit.source: A workflow endpoint now automatically closes if there are no active sessions, no in-progress jobs, and no pending jobs.
trans-unit.target: A workflow endpoint now automatically closes if there are no active sessions, no in-progress jobs, and no pending jobs.

trans-unit.source: This feature conserves resources on the computer that is acting as the workflow server, when the automatic closure conditions have been met.
trans-unit.target: This feature conserves resources on the computer that is acting as the workflow server, when the automatic closure conditions have been met.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell Web Services
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell Web Services

trans-unit.source: When an error occurs in Windows PowerShell Web Services (PSWS, also called Management OData IIS Extension), while a cmdlet is running, more detailed error messages are returned to the caller.
trans-unit.target: When an error occurs in Windows PowerShell Web Services (PSWS, also called Management OData IIS Extension), while a cmdlet is running, more detailed error messages are returned to the caller.

trans-unit.source: In addition, error codes follow [Windows Azure REST API error code guidelines](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dd179357.aspx).
trans-unit.target: In addition, error codes follow [Windows Azure REST API error code guidelines](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dd179357.aspx).

trans-unit.source: An endpoint can now define the API version, as well as enforce the usage of a specific API version.
trans-unit.target: An endpoint can now define the API version, as well as enforce the usage of a specific API version.

trans-unit.source: Whenever version mismatches occur between client and server, errors are displayed to both the client and the server.
trans-unit.target: Whenever version mismatches occur between client and server, errors are displayed to both the client and the server.

trans-unit.source: Management of the dispatch schema has been simplified by automatically generating values for any missing fields in the schema.
trans-unit.target: Management of the dispatch schema has been simplified by automatically generating values for any missing fields in the schema.

trans-unit.source: Generation occurs, as a helpful starting point, even if the dispatch schema does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Generation occurs, as a helpful starting point, even if the dispatch schema does not exist.

trans-unit.source: Type handling in PSWS has been improved to support types that use a different constructor than the default constructor, by behaving similarly to the **PSTypeConverter** in Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Type handling in PSWS has been improved to support types that use a different constructor than the default constructor, by behaving similarly to the **PSTypeConverter** in Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: This lets you use complex types with PSWS.
trans-unit.target: This lets you use complex types with PSWS.

trans-unit.source: PSWS now allows expanding an associated instance while running a query.
trans-unit.target: PSWS now allows expanding an associated instance while running a query.

trans-unit.source: For larger binary contents (such as images, audio, or video), the transfer cost is significant, and it is better to transfer binary data without encoding.
trans-unit.target: For larger binary contents (such as images, audio, or video), the transfer cost is significant, and it is better to transfer binary data without encoding.

trans-unit.source: PSWS uses named resource streams for transferring without encoding.
trans-unit.target: PSWS uses named resource streams for transferring without encoding.

trans-unit.source: The named resource stream is a property of an entity of the **Edm.Stream** type.
trans-unit.target: The named resource stream is a property of an entity of the **Edm.Stream** type.

trans-unit.source: Each named resource stream has a separate URI for GET or UPDATE operations.
trans-unit.target: Each named resource stream has a separate URI for GET or UPDATE operations.

trans-unit.source: OData actions now provide a mechanism for invoking non-CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) methods on a resource.
trans-unit.target: OData actions now provide a mechanism for invoking non-CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) methods on a resource.

trans-unit.source: You can invoke an action by sending an HTTP POST request to the URI that is defined for the action.
trans-unit.target: You can invoke an action by sending an HTTP POST request to the URI that is defined for the action.

trans-unit.source: The parameters for the action are defined in the body of the POST request.
trans-unit.target: The parameters for the action are defined in the body of the POST request.

trans-unit.source: To be consistent with Windows Azure guidelines, all URLs should be simplified.
trans-unit.target: To be consistent with Windows Azure guidelines, all URLs should be simplified.

trans-unit.source: A change included in **Key As Segment** allows single keys to be represented as segments.
trans-unit.target: A change included in **Key As Segment** allows single keys to be represented as segments.

trans-unit.source: Note that references that use multiple key values require comma-separated values in parenthetical notation, as before.
trans-unit.target: Note that references that use multiple key values require comma-separated values in parenthetical notation, as before.

trans-unit.source: Before this release of PSWS, the only way to perform Create, Update, or Delete operations was to invoke Post, Put, or Delete on a top-level resource.
trans-unit.target: Before this release of PSWS, the only way to perform Create, Update, or Delete operations was to invoke Post, Put, or Delete on a top-level resource.

trans-unit.source: New in this release of PSWS, Contained Resource operations let users achieve the same results while reaching the same resource less directly, approaching as if these resources were contained.
trans-unit.target: New in this release of PSWS, Contained Resource operations let users achieve the same results while reaching the same resource less directly, approaching as if these resources were contained.

trans-unit.source: New features in Windows PowerShell Web Access
trans-unit.target: New features in Windows PowerShell Web Access

trans-unit.source: You can disconnect from and reconnect to existing sessions in the web-based Windows PowerShell Web Access console.
trans-unit.target: You can disconnect from and reconnect to existing sessions in the web-based Windows PowerShell Web Access console.

trans-unit.source: A **Save** button in the web-based console lets you disconnect from a session without deleting it and reconnect to the session another time.
trans-unit.target: A **Save** button in the web-based console lets you disconnect from a session without deleting it and reconnect to the session another time.

trans-unit.source: Default parameters can be displayed on the sign-in page.
trans-unit.target: Default parameters can be displayed on the sign-in page.

trans-unit.source: To display default parameters, configure values for all of the settings displayed in the **Optional Connection Settings** area of the sign-in page in a file named **web.config**.
trans-unit.target: To display default parameters, configure values for all of the settings displayed in the **Optional Connection Settings** area of the sign-in page in a file named **web.config**.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **web.config** file to configure all optional connection settings except for a second or alternate set of credentials.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **web.config** file to configure all optional connection settings except for a second or alternate set of credentials.

trans-unit.source: In Windows Server 2012 R2, you can remotely manage authorization rules for Windows PowerShell Web Access.
trans-unit.target: In Windows Server 2012 R2, you can remotely manage authorization rules for Windows PowerShell Web Access.

trans-unit.source: The **Add-PswaAuthorizationRule** and **Test-PswaAuthorizationRule** cmdlets now include a Credential parameter that enables administrators to manage authorization rules from a remote computer or in a Windows PowerShell Web Access session.
trans-unit.target: The **Add-PswaAuthorizationRule** and **Test-PswaAuthorizationRule** cmdlets now include a Credential parameter that enables administrators to manage authorization rules from a remote computer or in a Windows PowerShell Web Access session.

trans-unit.source: You can now have multiple Windows PowerShell Web Access sessions in a single browser session by using a new browser tab for each session.
trans-unit.target: You can now have multiple Windows PowerShell Web Access sessions in a single browser session by using a new browser tab for each session.

trans-unit.source: You no longer need to open a new browser session to connect to a new session in the web-based Windows PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: You no longer need to open a new browser session to connect to a new session in the web-based Windows PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 4.0
trans-unit.target: Notable bug fixes in Windows PowerShell 4.0

trans-unit.source: **Get-Counter** can now return counters that contain an apostrophe character in French editions of Windows.
trans-unit.target: **Get-Counter** can now return counters that contain an apostrophe character in French editions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: You can now view the **GetType** method on deserialized objects.
trans-unit.target: You can now view the **GetType** method on deserialized objects.

trans-unit.source: **#Requires** statements now let users require Administrator access rights, if needed.
trans-unit.target: **#Requires** statements now let users require Administrator access rights, if needed.

trans-unit.source: The **Import-Csv** cmdlet now ignores blank lines.
trans-unit.target: The **Import-Csv** cmdlet now ignores blank lines.

trans-unit.source: A problem where Windows PowerShell ISE uses too much memory when you are running an **Invoke-WebRequest** command has been fixed.
trans-unit.target: A problem where Windows PowerShell ISE uses too much memory when you are running an **Invoke-WebRequest** command has been fixed.

trans-unit.source: **Get-Module** now displays module versions in a **Version** column.
trans-unit.target: **Get-Module** now displays module versions in a **Version** column.

trans-unit.source: Remove-Item –Recurse now removes items from subfolders as expected.
trans-unit.target: Remove-Item –Recurse now removes items from subfolders as expected.

trans-unit.source: A **UserName** property has been added to **Get-Process** output objects.
trans-unit.target: A **UserName** property has been added to **Get-Process** output objects.

trans-unit.source: The **Invoke-RestMethod** cmdlet now returns all available results.
trans-unit.target: The **Invoke-RestMethod** cmdlet now returns all available results.

trans-unit.source: **Add-Member** now takes effect on hashtables, even if the hashtables have not yet been accessed.
trans-unit.target: **Add-Member** now takes effect on hashtables, even if the hashtables have not yet been accessed.

trans-unit.source: **Select-Object –Expand** no longer fails or generates an exception if the value of the property is null or empty.
trans-unit.target: **Select-Object –Expand** no longer fails or generates an exception if the value of the property is null or empty.

trans-unit.source: **Get-Process** can now be used in a pipeline with other commands that get the **ComputerName** property from objects.
trans-unit.target: **Get-Process** can now be used in a pipeline with other commands that get the **ComputerName** property from objects.

trans-unit.source: **ConvertTo-Json** and **ConvertFrom-Json** can now accept terms within double quotes, and its error messages are now localizable.
trans-unit.target: **ConvertTo-Json** and **ConvertFrom-Json** can now accept terms within double quotes, and its error messages are now localizable.

trans-unit.source: **Get-Job** now returns any completed scheduled jobs, even in new sessions.
trans-unit.target: **Get-Job** now returns any completed scheduled jobs, even in new sessions.

trans-unit.source: Issues with mounting and unmounting VHDs by using the **FileSystem** provider in Windows PowerShell 4.0 have been fixed.
trans-unit.target: Issues with mounting and unmounting VHDs by using the **FileSystem** provider in Windows PowerShell 4.0 have been fixed.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell is now able to detect new drives when they are mounted in the same session.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell is now able to detect new drives when they are mounted in the same session.

trans-unit.source: You no longer need to explicitly load **ScheduledJob** or **Workflow** modules to work with their job types.
trans-unit.target: You no longer need to explicitly load **ScheduledJob** or **Workflow** modules to work with their job types.

trans-unit.source: Performance improvements have been made to the process of importing workflows that define nested workflows; this process is now faster.
trans-unit.target: Performance improvements have been made to the process of importing workflows that define nested workflows; this process is now faster.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Workflow
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Workflow

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShellÂ® Workflow brings the power of Windows Workflow Foundation to Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShellÂ® Workflow brings the power of Windows Workflow Foundation to Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: You can write workflows in XAML or in the Windows PowerShell language and run them just as you would run a cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can write workflows in XAML or in the Windows PowerShell language and run them just as you would run a cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The [Get-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/59c6d302-6e8c-48b7-a6f6-f0172df936ad) cmdlet gets workflw commands and the [Get-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1f46eeb4-49d7-4bec-bb29-395d9b42f54a) cmdlet gets help for workflows.
trans-unit.target: The [Get-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/59c6d302-6e8c-48b7-a6f6-f0172df936ad) cmdlet gets workflw commands and the [Get-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1f46eeb4-49d7-4bec-bb29-395d9b42f54a) cmdlet gets help for workflows.

trans-unit.source: Workflows are sequences of multicomputer management activities that are long-running, repeatable, frequent, parallelizable, interruptible, suspendable, and restartable.
trans-unit.target: Workflows are sequences of multicomputer management activities that are long-running, repeatable, frequent, parallelizable, interruptible, suspendable, and restartable.

trans-unit.source: Workflows can be resumed from an intentional or accidental interruption, such as a network outage, a Windows restart, or a power failure.
trans-unit.target: Workflows can be resumed from an intentional or accidental interruption, such as a network outage, a Windows restart, or a power failure.

trans-unit.source: Workflows are also portable; they can be exported as or imported from XAML files.
trans-unit.target: Workflows are also portable; they can be exported as or imported from XAML files.

trans-unit.source: You can write custom session configurations that allow workflow or activities in a workflow to be run by delegated or subordinate users.
trans-unit.target: You can write custom session configurations that allow workflow or activities in a workflow to be run by delegated or subordinate users.

trans-unit.source: The following are the benefits of Windows PowerShell Workflow
trans-unit.target: The following are the benefits of Windows PowerShell Workflow

trans-unit.source: **Automation of sequenced, long-running tasks.**
trans-unit.target: **Automation of sequenced, long-running tasks.**

trans-unit.source: **Remote monitoring of long-running tasks**.
trans-unit.target: **Remote monitoring of long-running tasks**.

trans-unit.source: Status and progress of activities are visible at any time.
trans-unit.target: Status and progress of activities are visible at any time.

trans-unit.source: **Multicomputer management.**
trans-unit.target: **Multicomputer management.**

trans-unit.source: Simultaneously run tasks as workflows on hundreds of managed nodes.
trans-unit.target: Simultaneously run tasks as workflows on hundreds of managed nodes.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Workflow includes a built-in library of common management parameters, such as **PSComputerName**, which enable multi-computer management scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Workflow includes a built-in library of common management parameters, such as **PSComputerName**, which enable multi-computer management scenarios.

trans-unit.source: **Single task execution of complex processes.**
trans-unit.target: **Single task execution of complex processes.**

trans-unit.source: You can combine related scripts that implement an entire end-to-end scenario into a single workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can combine related scripts that implement an entire end-to-end scenario into a single workflow.

trans-unit.source: **Persistence.**: a workflow is saved (or check-pointed) at specific points defined by its author so you can resume the workflow from the last persisted task (or checkpoint), instead of restarting the workflow from the beginning.
trans-unit.target: **Persistence.**: a workflow is saved (or check-pointed) at specific points defined by its author so you can resume the workflow from the last persisted task (or checkpoint), instead of restarting the workflow from the beginning.

trans-unit.source: **Robustness.**
trans-unit.target: **Robustness.**

trans-unit.source: Automated failure recovery.
trans-unit.target: Automated failure recovery.

trans-unit.source: Workflows survive planned and unplanned restarts.
trans-unit.target: Workflows survive planned and unplanned restarts.

trans-unit.source: You can suspend workflow execution and then resume the workflow from the last persistence point.
trans-unit.target: You can suspend workflow execution and then resume the workflow from the last persistence point.

trans-unit.source: Workflow authors can designate specific activities to be re-run in case of failure on one or more managed nodes.
trans-unit.target: Workflow authors can designate specific activities to be re-run in case of failure on one or more managed nodes.

trans-unit.source: **Ability to disconnect, reconnect, and run in disconnected sessions.**
trans-unit.target: **Ability to disconnect, reconnect, and run in disconnected sessions.**

trans-unit.source: Users can connect and disconnect from the workflow server, but the workflow runs continuously.
trans-unit.target: Users can connect and disconnect from the workflow server, but the workflow runs continuously.

trans-unit.source: You can log off of the client computer or restart the client computer and monitor the workflow execution from another computer without interrupting the workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can log off of the client computer or restart the client computer and monitor the workflow execution from another computer without interrupting the workflow.

trans-unit.source: **Scheduling.**
trans-unit.target: **Scheduling.**

trans-unit.source: Workflow tasks can be scheduled like any Windows PowerShell cmdlet or script.
trans-unit.target: Workflow tasks can be scheduled like any Windows PowerShell cmdlet or script.

trans-unit.source: **Workflow and Connection Throttling.**
trans-unit.target: **Workflow and Connection Throttling.**

trans-unit.source: Workflow execution and connections to nodes can be throttled, thus enabling scalability and high-availability scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Workflow execution and connections to nodes can be throttled, thus enabling scalability and high-availability scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Web Access
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Web Access

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShellÂ® Web Access is a Windows Server 2012 feature that lets users run Windows PowerShell commands and scripts in a web-based console.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShellÂ® Web Access is a Windows Server 2012 feature that lets users run Windows PowerShell commands and scripts in a web-based console.

trans-unit.source: Devices that use the web-based console do not require Windows PowerShell, remote management software, or browser plug-in installations.
trans-unit.target: Devices that use the web-based console do not require Windows PowerShell, remote management software, or browser plug-in installations.

trans-unit.source: All that is required is a properly-configured Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway and a client device browser that supports JavaScript® and accepts cookies.
trans-unit.target: All that is required is a properly-configured Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway and a client device browser that supports JavaScript® and accepts cookies.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Deploy Windows PowerShell Web Access](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=221050).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Deploy Windows PowerShell Web Access](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=221050).

trans-unit.source: New Windows PowerShell ISE Features
trans-unit.target: New Windows PowerShell ISE Features

trans-unit.source: For Windows PowerShell 3.0, Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) has many new features, including IntelliSense, Show-Command window, a unified Console Pane, snippets, brace-matching, expand-collapse sections, auto-save, recent items list, rich copy, block copy, and full support for writing Windows PowerShell script workflows.
trans-unit.target: For Windows PowerShell 3.0, Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) has many new features, including IntelliSense, Show-Command window, a unified Console Pane, snippets, brace-matching, expand-collapse sections, auto-save, recent items list, rich copy, block copy, and full support for writing Windows PowerShell script workflows.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [about_Windows_PowerShell_ISE [v3]](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dfa54d47-60c6-4fff-8197-c747e8d411bb).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [about_Windows_PowerShell_ISE [v3]](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dfa54d47-60c6-4fff-8197-c747e8d411bb).

trans-unit.source: Support for Microsoft .NET Framework 4
trans-unit.target: Support for Microsoft .NET Framework 4

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell is built against the Common Language Runtime 4.0.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell is built against the Common Language Runtime 4.0.

trans-unit.source: Cmdlet, script, and workflow authors can use the new Microsoft .NET Framework 4 classes in Windows PowerShell, with features that include Application Compatibility and Deployment, Managed Extensibility Framework, Parallel Computing, Networking, Windows Communication Foundation and Windows Workflow Foundation.
trans-unit.target: Cmdlet, script, and workflow authors can use the new Microsoft .NET Framework 4 classes in Windows PowerShell, with features that include Application Compatibility and Deployment, Managed Extensibility Framework, Parallel Computing, Networking, Windows Communication Foundation and Windows Workflow Foundation.

trans-unit.source: Support for Windows Preinstallation Environment
trans-unit.target: Support for Windows Preinstallation Environment

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 3.0 is an optional component of Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) 4.0 for Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 is an optional component of Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) 4.0 for Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: Windows PE is a minimal operating system that starts a computer that has no operating system and prepares it for Windows installation.
trans-unit.target: Windows PE is a minimal operating system that starts a computer that has no operating system and prepares it for Windows installation.

trans-unit.source: Windows PE can be used to partition and format hard drives, copy disk images to a computer, and initiate Windows Setup from a network share.
trans-unit.target: Windows PE can be used to partition and format hard drives, copy disk images to a computer, and initiate Windows Setup from a network share.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 3.0 can be used on Windows PE to manage deployment, diagnostics, and recovery scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 can be used on Windows PE to manage deployment, diagnostics, and recovery scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Disconnected Sessions
trans-unit.target: Disconnected Sessions

trans-unit.source: Beginning in Windows PowerShell 3.0, persistent user-managed sessions ("PSSessions") that you create by using the New-PSSession cmdlet are saved on the remote computer.
trans-unit.target: Beginning in Windows PowerShell 3.0, persistent user-managed sessions ("PSSessions") that you create by using the New-PSSession cmdlet are saved on the remote computer.

trans-unit.source: They are no longer dependent on the session in which they were created.
trans-unit.target: They are no longer dependent on the session in which they were created.

trans-unit.source: You can now disconnect from a session without disrupting the commands that are running in the session.
trans-unit.target: You can now disconnect from a session without disrupting the commands that are running in the session.

trans-unit.source: You can close the session and shut down your computer.
trans-unit.target: You can close the session and shut down your computer.

trans-unit.source: Later, you can reconnect to the session from a different session on the same or on a different computer.
trans-unit.target: Later, you can reconnect to the session from a different session on the same or on a different computer.

trans-unit.source: The **ComputerName** parameter of the [Get-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b2b10531-d0df-4746-b877-e75c09955cb6) cmdlet now gets all of the user's sessions that connect to the computer, even if they were started in a different session on a different computer.
trans-unit.target: The **ComputerName** parameter of the [Get-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b2b10531-d0df-4746-b877-e75c09955cb6) cmdlet now gets all of the user's sessions that connect to the computer, even if they were started in a different session on a different computer.

trans-unit.source: You can connect to the sessions, get the results of commands, start new commands, and then disconnect from the session.
trans-unit.target: You can connect to the sessions, get the results of commands, start new commands, and then disconnect from the session.

trans-unit.source: New cmdlets have been added to support the Disconnected Sessions feature, including [Disconnect-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/f8f95111-612f-4cba-9098-77904b0473d8), [Connect-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b803dd29-f208-4079-80d4-db04d778f060), and Receive-PSSession, and new parameters have been added to cmdlets that manage PSSessions, such as the **InDisconnectedSession** parameter of the [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/906b4b41-7da8-4330-9363-e7164e5e6970) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: New cmdlets have been added to support the Disconnected Sessions feature, including [Disconnect-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/f8f95111-612f-4cba-9098-77904b0473d8), [Connect-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b803dd29-f208-4079-80d4-db04d778f060), and Receive-PSSession, and new parameters have been added to cmdlets that manage PSSessions, such as the **InDisconnectedSession** parameter of the [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/906b4b41-7da8-4330-9363-e7164e5e6970) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The Disconnected Sessions feature is supported only when the computers at both the originating ("client") and terminating ("server") ends of the connection are running Windows PowerShell 3.0.
trans-unit.target: The Disconnected Sessions feature is supported only when the computers at both the originating ("client") and terminating ("server") ends of the connection are running Windows PowerShell 3.0.

trans-unit.source: Robust Session Connectivity
trans-unit.target: Robust Session Connectivity

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 3.0 detects unexpected losses of connectivity between the client and server and attempts to reestablish connectivity and resume execution automatically.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 detects unexpected losses of connectivity between the client and server and attempts to reestablish connectivity and resume execution automatically.

trans-unit.source: If the client-server connection cannot be reestablished in the allotted time, the user is notified and the session is disconnected.
trans-unit.target: If the client-server connection cannot be reestablished in the allotted time, the user is notified and the session is disconnected.

trans-unit.source: During the attempt to reconnect, Windows PowerShell provides continuous feedback to the user.
trans-unit.target: During the attempt to reconnect, Windows PowerShell provides continuous feedback to the user.

trans-unit.source: If the disconnected session was started by using the InvokeCommand, Windows PowerShell creates a job for the disconnected session to make it easier to reconnect and resume execution.
trans-unit.target: If the disconnected session was started by using the InvokeCommand, Windows PowerShell creates a job for the disconnected session to make it easier to reconnect and resume execution.

trans-unit.source: These features provide a more reliable and recoverable remoting experience and allow users to perform long-running tasks that require robust sessions, such as workflows.
trans-unit.target: These features provide a more reliable and recoverable remoting experience and allow users to perform long-running tasks that require robust sessions, such as workflows.

trans-unit.source: Updatable Help System
trans-unit.target: Updatable Help System

trans-unit.source: You can now download updated help files for the cmdlets in your modules.
trans-unit.target: You can now download updated help files for the cmdlets in your modules.

trans-unit.source: The [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet identifies the newest help files, downloads them from the Internet, unpacks them, validates them, and installs them in the correct language-specific directory for the module.
trans-unit.target: The [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet identifies the newest help files, downloads them from the Internet, unpacks them, validates them, and installs them in the correct language-specific directory for the module.

trans-unit.source: To use the updated help files, just type `Get-Help`.
trans-unit.target: To use the updated help files, just type `Get-Help`.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to restart Windows or Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to restart Windows or Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: To update help for modules in the $pshome directory, start Windows PowerShell with the "Run as administrator" option.
trans-unit.target: To update help for modules in the $pshome directory, start Windows PowerShell with the "Run as administrator" option.

trans-unit.source: To support users who don't have Internet access and users behind firewalls, the new [Save-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aed94f90-b73f-4e25-a25d-7c18d9f161fa) cmdlet downloads help files to a file system directory, such as a file share.
trans-unit.target: To support users who don't have Internet access and users behind firewalls, the new [Save-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aed94f90-b73f-4e25-a25d-7c18d9f161fa) cmdlet downloads help files to a file system directory, such as a file share.

trans-unit.source: Users can then use the [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet to get updated help files from the file share.
trans-unit.target: Users can then use the [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet to get updated help files from the file share.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet to update help files for all or particular modules in all supported UI cultures.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet to update help files for all or particular modules in all supported UI cultures.

trans-unit.source: You can even put an [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) command in your Windows PowerShell profile.
trans-unit.target: You can even put an [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) command in your Windows PowerShell profile.

trans-unit.source: By default, Windows PowerShell downloads the help files for a module no more than once each day.
trans-unit.target: By default, Windows PowerShell downloads the help files for a module no more than once each day.

trans-unit.source: Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 modules do not include help files.
trans-unit.target: Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 modules do not include help files.

trans-unit.source: To download the latest help files, type `Update-Help`.
trans-unit.target: To download the latest help files, type `Update-Help`.

trans-unit.source: For more information, type `Get-Help` (without parameters) or see [about_Updatable_Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/10bba75c-f4ac-4ca1-bbf3-8f34dd521ffe).
trans-unit.target: For more information, type `Get-Help` (without parameters) or see [about_Updatable_Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/10bba75c-f4ac-4ca1-bbf3-8f34dd521ffe).

trans-unit.source: When the help files for a cmdlet are not installed on the computer, the [Get-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1f46eeb4-49d7-4bec-bb29-395d9b42f54a) cmdlet now displays auto-generated help.
trans-unit.target: When the help files for a cmdlet are not installed on the computer, the [Get-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1f46eeb4-49d7-4bec-bb29-395d9b42f54a) cmdlet now displays auto-generated help.

trans-unit.source: The auto-generated help includes the command syntax and instructions for using the [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet to download help files.
trans-unit.target: The auto-generated help includes the command syntax and instructions for using the [Update-Help](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/93e1d870-ace6-432b-8778-8920291d7545) cmdlet to download help files.

trans-unit.source: Any module author can support Updatable Help for their module.
trans-unit.target: Any module author can support Updatable Help for their module.

trans-unit.source: You can include help files in the module and use Updatable Help to update them or omit the help files and use Updatable Help to install them.
trans-unit.target: You can include help files in the module and use Updatable Help to update them or omit the help files and use Updatable Help to install them.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supporting Updatable Help, see [Supporting Updatable Help](http://go.microsoft.com/FWLink/?LinkID=242129) in MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supporting Updatable Help, see [Supporting Updatable Help](http://go.microsoft.com/FWLink/?LinkID=242129) in MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Enhanced Online Help
trans-unit.target: Enhanced Online Help

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell online help is a valuable resource for all users, but it is especially important to users who do not or cannot install updated help files.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell online help is a valuable resource for all users, but it is especially important to users who do not or cannot install updated help files.

trans-unit.source: To get online help for any Windows PowerShell cmdlet, type:
trans-unit.target: To get online help for any Windows PowerShell cmdlet, type:

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell opens the online version of the help topic in your default Internet browser.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell opens the online version of the help topic in your default Internet browser.

trans-unit.source: The **Get-Help -Online** feature in Windows PowerShell 3.0 is now even more powerful because it works even when help files for the cmdlet are not installed on the computer.
trans-unit.target: The **Get-Help -Online** feature in Windows PowerShell 3.0 is now even more powerful because it works even when help files for the cmdlet are not installed on the computer.

trans-unit.source: The **Get-Help -Online** feature gets the URI for online help topic from the HelpUri property of cmdlets and advanced functions.
trans-unit.target: The **Get-Help -Online** feature gets the URI for online help topic from the HelpUri property of cmdlets and advanced functions.

trans-unit.source: Beginning in Windows PowerShell 3.0, authors of C# cmdlets can populate the **HelpUri** property by creating a **HelpUri** attribute on the cmdlet class.
trans-unit.target: Beginning in Windows PowerShell 3.0, authors of C# cmdlets can populate the **HelpUri** property by creating a **HelpUri** attribute on the cmdlet class.

trans-unit.source: Authors of advanced functions can define a **HelpUri** property on the **CmdletBinding** attribute.
trans-unit.target: Authors of advanced functions can define a **HelpUri** property on the **CmdletBinding** attribute.

trans-unit.source: The value of the **HelpUri** property must begin with "http" or "https".
trans-unit.target: The value of the **HelpUri** property must begin with "http" or "https".

trans-unit.source: You can also include a **HelpUri** value in the first related link of an XML-based cmdlet help file or the .Link directive of comment-based help in a function.
trans-unit.target: You can also include a **HelpUri** value in the first related link of an XML-based cmdlet help file or the .Link directive of comment-based help in a function.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supporting online help, see [Supporting Online Help](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=242132) in MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supporting online help, see [Supporting Online Help](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=242132) in MSDN.

trans-unit.source: CIM integration
trans-unit.target: CIM integration

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 3.0 includes support for the Common Information Model (CIM), which provides common definitions of management information for systems, networks, applications, and services, allowing them the exchange of management information between heterogeneous systems.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 includes support for the Common Information Model (CIM), which provides common definitions of management information for systems, networks, applications, and services, allowing them the exchange of management information between heterogeneous systems.

trans-unit.source: Support for CIM in Windows PowerShell 3.0, including the ability to author Windows PowerShell cmdlets based on new or existing CIM classes, commands based on cmdlet definition XML files, support for CIM .NET Framework.
trans-unit.target: Support for CIM in Windows PowerShell 3.0, including the ability to author Windows PowerShell cmdlets based on new or existing CIM classes, commands based on cmdlet definition XML files, support for CIM .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: API, CIM management cmdlets and WMI 2.0 providers.
trans-unit.target: API, CIM management cmdlets and WMI 2.0 providers.

trans-unit.source: Session Configuration Files
trans-unit.target: Session Configuration Files

trans-unit.source: Beginning in Windows PowerShell 3.0, you can design a custom session configuration by using a file.
trans-unit.target: Beginning in Windows PowerShell 3.0, you can design a custom session configuration by using a file.

trans-unit.source: The new session configuration file lets you determine the environment of sessions that use the session configuration, including which modules, scripts, and format files are loaded into sessions, which cmdlets and language elements users can use, which modules and scripts they can run, and which variables they can see.
trans-unit.target: The new session configuration file lets you determine the environment of sessions that use the session configuration, including which modules, scripts, and format files are loaded into sessions, which cmdlets and language elements users can use, which modules and scripts they can run, and which variables they can see.

trans-unit.source: You can design a session in which users can only run the cmdlets from one particular module, or a session in which users have full language, access to all modules, and access to scripts that perform advanced tasks.
trans-unit.target: You can design a session in which users can only run the cmdlets from one particular module, or a session in which users have full language, access to all modules, and access to scripts that perform advanced tasks.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of Windows PowerShell, control at this level was available only to those who could write a C# program or a complex start-up script.
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of Windows PowerShell, control at this level was available only to those who could write a C# program or a complex start-up script.

trans-unit.source: Now, any member of the Administrators group on the computer can customize a session configuration by using a configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Now, any member of the Administrators group on the computer can customize a session configuration by using a configuration file.

trans-unit.source: To create a session configuration file, use the [New-PSSessionConfigurationFile](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/5f3e3633-6e90-479c-aea9-ba45a1954866) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To create a session configuration file, use the [New-PSSessionConfigurationFile](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/5f3e3633-6e90-479c-aea9-ba45a1954866) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: To apply the session configuration file to a session configuration, use the [Register-PSSessionConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/e9152ae2-bd6d-4056-9bc7-dc1893aa29ea) or [Set-PSSessionConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b21fbad3-1759-4260-b206-dcb8431cd6ea) cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: To apply the session configuration file to a session configuration, use the [Register-PSSessionConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/e9152ae2-bd6d-4056-9bc7-dc1893aa29ea) or [Set-PSSessionConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/b21fbad3-1759-4260-b206-dcb8431cd6ea) cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [about_Session_Configuration_Files](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c7217447-1ebf-477b-a8ef-4dbe9a1473b8) and [New-PSSessionConfigurationFile](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/5f3e3633-6e90-479c-aea9-ba45a1954866).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [about_Session_Configuration_Files](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/c7217447-1ebf-477b-a8ef-4dbe9a1473b8) and [New-PSSessionConfigurationFile](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/5f3e3633-6e90-479c-aea9-ba45a1954866).

trans-unit.source: Scheduled Jobs and Task Scheduler Integration
trans-unit.target: Scheduled Jobs and Task Scheduler Integration

trans-unit.source: You can now schedule Windows PowerShell background jobs and manage them in Windows PowerShell and in Task Scheduler.
trans-unit.target: You can now schedule Windows PowerShell background jobs and manage them in Windows PowerShell and in Task Scheduler.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell scheduled jobs are a useful hybrid of Windows PowerShell background jobs and Task Scheduler tasks.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell scheduled jobs are a useful hybrid of Windows PowerShell background jobs and Task Scheduler tasks.

trans-unit.source: Like Windows PowerShell background jobs, scheduled jobs run asynchronously in the background.
trans-unit.target: Like Windows PowerShell background jobs, scheduled jobs run asynchronously in the background.

trans-unit.source: Instances of scheduled jobs that have completed can be managed by using the job cmdlets, such as [Start-Job](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/2bc04935-0deb-4ec0-b856-d7290cca6442) and [Get-Job](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1352c534-7193-46ca-9ab1-0c5219a661ad).
trans-unit.target: Instances of scheduled jobs that have completed can be managed by using the job cmdlets, such as [Start-Job](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/2bc04935-0deb-4ec0-b856-d7290cca6442) and [Get-Job](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1352c534-7193-46ca-9ab1-0c5219a661ad).

trans-unit.source: Like Task Scheduler tasks, you can run scheduled jobs on a one-time or recurrent schedule, or in response to an action or event.
trans-unit.target: Like Task Scheduler tasks, you can run scheduled jobs on a one-time or recurrent schedule, or in response to an action or event.

trans-unit.source: You can view and manage scheduled jobs in Task Scheduler, enable and disable them as needed, run them or use them as templates, and set conditions under which the jobs start.
trans-unit.target: You can view and manage scheduled jobs in Task Scheduler, enable and disable them as needed, run them or use them as templates, and set conditions under which the jobs start.

trans-unit.source: In addition, scheduled jobs come with a customized set of cmdlets for managing them.
trans-unit.target: In addition, scheduled jobs come with a customized set of cmdlets for managing them.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlets let you create, edit, manage, disable, and re-enable scheduled jobs, create scheduled job triggers and set scheduled job options.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlets let you create, edit, manage, disable, and re-enable scheduled jobs, create scheduled job triggers and set scheduled job options.

trans-unit.source: For more information about scheduled jobs, see [about_Scheduled_Jobs](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/3b546629-703c-4939-b44f-52dd567bce92).
trans-unit.target: For more information about scheduled jobs, see [about_Scheduled_Jobs](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/3b546629-703c-4939-b44f-52dd567bce92).

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Language Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Language Enhancements

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell 3.0 includes many features that are designed to make its language simpler, easier to use, and to avoid common errors.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell 3.0 includes many features that are designed to make its language simpler, easier to use, and to avoid common errors.

trans-unit.source: The improvements include property enumeration, count and length properties on scalar objects, new redirection operators, the $Using scope modifier, PSItem automatic variable, flexible script formatting, attributes of variables, simplified attribute arguments, numeric command names, the Stop-Parsing operator, improved array splatting, new bit operators, ordered dictionaries, PSCustomObject casting, and improved comment-based help.
trans-unit.target: The improvements include property enumeration, count and length properties on scalar objects, new redirection operators, the $Using scope modifier, PSItem automatic variable, flexible script formatting, attributes of variables, simplified attribute arguments, numeric command names, the Stop-Parsing operator, improved array splatting, new bit operators, ordered dictionaries, PSCustomObject casting, and improved comment-based help.

trans-unit.target: New Core Cmdlets

trans-unit.target: New cmdlets were added to the Windows PowerShell Core installation, including cmdlets to manage scheduled jobs, disconnected sessions, CIM integration and the Updatable Help System.
